Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION 2026 - Winter W26 Intern, Software Developer (Toronto) 173219B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description Job Requisition ID # 25WD91604 Position overview: Our Trust Platform Integrations team focuses on building solution for Autodesk developers to build security, resilience, and privacy into their products and services with easy to use and scalable software integrations and tool. We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Software Engineering Intern to join our dedicated team. In this role, you will contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of robust integrations for various security tools. You will partner with internal teams outside of Trust to create solutions that facilitate building trust in our products and services. Please note that this is a position for Winter 2026 (January -April 2026 work term) Key Responsibilities: • Assist in the integration and management of security tools in developer pipeline. • Assist in the implementation and management of supply chain security. • Develop automation scripts and tools to streamline security processes and improve efficiency. • Support infrastructure setup and deployment for security tools, such as JFrog Xray, to enable their smooth integration and operation. Qualifications: • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field. • Basic understanding of application security principles and practices. • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Preferred Qualifications: • Experience with programming languages such as Java, C++, or Python. • Experience with AWS. • Experience with CI/CD, Jenkins, and Docker. Understanding of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies • Job Requirements Qualifications: • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field. • Basic understanding of application security principles and practices. • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. • Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Preferred Qualifications: • Experience with programming languages such as Java, C++, or Python. • • Experience with AWS. Experience with CI/CD, Jenkins, and Docker. Understanding of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required?
